channel.title: Error connecting to server
channel.description: the client on my computer,(im hoster), connects to the server. i created a copy of the client without any java files, i changed the ip in egui.java, AND COMPILED, but when i download on other computer, it says error connecting to server, and yes i portforwarded

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

For B to connect to A, the client IP on B has to be the IPv4 Address of A.

For anyone else to connect, you need to port forward and change the IP to your actual IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad

coorect, but i want to my friends to login too

Okay… This is your scenario right?

Computer A
Computer B

You are hosting a server on A and your trying to login from B right?

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

mrjad:

i went to egui.java. changed the ip to mine,(did this before, just doublechecked it now) and compiled, but its not the problem

Did you not read my other posts?
If you are on the same NETWORK as the HOST computer, the IP ADDRESS for YOU will be the IPV4 ADDRESS of the HOST computer.
I cannot explain it any better than that… Actually I can
IP Address != IPv4

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

mrjad:

the client on my computer,(im hoster), connects to the server. i created a copy of the client without any java files, i changed the ip in egui.java, AND COMPILED, but when i download on other computer, it says error connecting to server, and yes i portforwarded

If your on another computer but on the same network, you use the host computers IPv4 as the server ip.

Read full topic

and the ip is right

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @mrjad mrjad
item.description:
@mrjad wrote:

Success: I can see your service on 76.22(oops posted ip) on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

so… what do i do? O.o

dont u just love slim chances

Read full topic

item.title: Error connecting to server
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

mrjad:

the client on my computer,(im hoster), connects to the server. i created a copy of the client without any java files, i changed the ip in egui.java, AND COMPILED, but when i download on other computer, it says error connecting to server, and yes i didn’t portforward. can someone tell me how to?

fixed and if i am wrong (which is a slim chance I will be) go check with the open port checker tool. http://www.canyouseeme.org/ post 43594 in the “what port?” box and it should say

Success: I can see your service on ##.##.##.### on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

} else if(port43594 = false)) {

Error: I could not see your service on ...* on port (43594)
[size=9pt]Reason: Connection timed out[/size]

Read full topic
